channel.title: Vista error during attempted overide
channel.description:
I can't seem to be able to install an XP over Vista. The disc works perfectly fine since I've installed it over my old XP on my other computer. But on my new computer when I get to the part where it asks me about partitions all I see is just "Unknown Partition" on all four slots. And when I click anything it takes me to a blue screen with stuff written like, "Computer stopped OS install to prevent any damage" or something like that.
I've tried erasing all my partitions with a software and even after that I get the same error.
Help with be greatly appreciated :)

item.title: Vista error during attempted overide
item.dc:creator: @JukuG JukuG
item.description:
@JukuG wrote:

To format do I just simply right click on all my drives and press ‘Format…’ right?

1337h4x:

Hm, posting in the right section always works for me.

Has never worked for me before

Thanks for moving topic.

Read full topic

item.title: Vista error during attempted overide
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

I think Vista uses a different format than NTFS, so that’s why XP says it’s “Unknown”. Do as ThugLife says, try formatting.

Read full topic

item.title: Vista error during attempted overide
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Try formatting your hard drive then installing it?

Read full topic
